result.execSummary:
The defendant Travin Richard Burda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Travin Richard Burda is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Travin Richard Burda was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Pro Se Motion to have the Court allow the defendant to receive gift money from his family and friends without the State taking Court Restitution/Court Obligations.
Court denies motion.

Defendant Travin Richard Burda in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Travin Richard Burda in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court sentences defendant to 6 1/2 years in WI Prison system; 1 yr. 6 mos. IC, 5 yrs ES consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 36 days; provide a DNA sample; pay costs; find eligible for SAP; no eligible for CIP; advised of felony conviction prohibitions, appeal rights.
Sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 04:00 pm. Rescheduled from 10/10/2016 at 3:00 pm
Sentencing hearing on October 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Travin Richard Burda in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Travin Richard Burda in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs of agreement, w/held sentence, 2 yrs. probation, free to argue jail, State recommends 6 mos. in PCJ with credit for 11 days served.  Atty Rivard requests court consider 4 mos. jail with huber privileges.  Court informs he's on probation in MN for 5 yrs for drug charges, was on probation in Buffalo County, considering prison sentence, why put him back on probation.  Sentencing to be rescheduled with scheduling clerk.  Court sets $5000 cash bond.
Sentencing hearing on September 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Count 2
Sentencing hearing on September 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Travin Richard Burda in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge in count 1/max penalties.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea Colloquy.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty; dismiss count 2 and dismiss 15CM66.  No PSI requested.  Referred to scheduling clerk for sentencing date @ 30-45 days out.  Remove JT.  Address updated W3098 Cty Rd R, Durand, WI.

Defendant Travin Richard Burda in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will plead to Ct 1 in 16CF06, 15CM66 w/be dismissed.

Final pre-trial on August 1, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Jury trial on August 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on August 29, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.  Time allowed for trial is one day(s).
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for August 1, 2016 at 4:00 p.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than July 13, 2016. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than July 13, 2016, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions. .... 
For complete Order see file.

Defendant Travin Richard Burda in court in Buffalo County with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Travin Richard Burda in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties, felony prohibitions and rights.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters NGP to all charges.  Atty Rivard notes he has a companion case in Buffalo County; requests speedy trial on this case.  Atty Rivard to contact the scheduling clerk for scheduling.  Any conditions of bond previously set are continued.
Defendant appeared in Court for hearing requested by Attorney Rivard.

Defendant Travin Richard Burda in court in Buffalo County with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Travin Richard Burda in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to a prelim. hrg., waiver form completed and to be provided to clerk in Buffalo County.  Court finds defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing done knowingly & voluntarily, binds defendant over for trial.  DA files Information with the Court.
Preliminary hearing on June 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Travin Richard Burda in court.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen appeared by phone means for Defendant Travin Richard Burda.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Peterson represents defendant in 15CM66 appointed by the court.  Ms. Peterson informs court she can't represent Mr. Burda on new case as she represents the other person involved.  Defendant requests 1 lawyer be appointed for both cases.  Court thanks Ms. Peterson and removes her as counsel.  Off record for defendant to meet with SPD representative.  On record, defendant now appears with Atty Waters of SPD who informs defendant qualifies for PD representation.  Defendant waives right to PH in 16CF06.  SPD will assign counsel.   Adjourned Initial Appearance scheduled for March 1, 2016 @ 2:30 p.m.
